text:
Chez moi, une addiction à leurs pâtisseries aux pistaches et à leurs danoises aux framboises s'est développée très rapidement. Vraiment décadent. Les prix sont un peu élevés, oui, mais la qualité est là. Leurs pains sont délicieux et il y a un rabais de 15% ou 20% je crois sur les produits de la veille, intéressant pour moi et sûrement plusieurs autres personnes.

Quand au café, il est correct, mais pas mon préféré. Je n'ai pas encore goûté à beaucoup de leurs produits, alors mon avis s'arrête ici.

J'apprécie la petite terrasse à l'avant toute mignonne pour rencontrer des amis et discuter relax au soleil.

- lovely outdoor seating during the summer
- flaky delicious croissant 
-  roast beef sandwich
Great little lunch place - interesting sandwiches and amazing desserts and treats! Will definitely go again!
Very busy on weekends so while the bakery delivers great things the same can't be said of the watery lattes and over stressed staff.

J'adore cet endroit et pas seulement parce que c'est à 5 minutes de marche de chez moi! 

La raison pour laquelle j'y vais le plus souvent c'est pour leurs fromages! Il y a une sélection assez impressionnante de fromages du Québec (aucun fromage d'ailleurs ne met les pieds dans la boutique!). Comme j'aime beaucoup découvrir, je demande toujours au commis des suggestions et il nous fait tout goûter! Ça c'est du service!

Évidemment, leur section boulangerie est tout aussi plaisante. Leurs baguettes sont très bonnes et ils vendent des pains paninis aux saveurs variantes de semaines en semaines. J'en ai acheté un aux carottes il y a quelques semaines qui était délicieux! 

Aussi, j'aime bien les tablettes remplies de produits fins d'ici qui couvrent les murs de la boutique. Des confitures, des gelées, des chocolats et même les crèmes glacées de chez Les Givrés (pas sur les tablettes, mais dans un congélateur bien sûr!)...

Près de la caisse, on retrouve les pâtisseries qui sont toujours très bonnes (surtout la tartelette choco-caramel) même si les saveurs ne changent pas assez fréquemment à mon goût. Il y a également des brownies de 2 pouces d'épaisseur qui ont l'air cochon à mort, des biscuits et des viennoiseries.

Pour ceux qui voudrait remplir live un petit creux, l'endroit vend également des breuvages, des sandwichs et des salades maisons. Des tables sont disponibles à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur pour vous permettre de savourer!
The best dark chocolate pastry i have ever tired, i wish there is a store in Toronto. Definitely on my to-go list when traveling in Montreal

I walked past this place a number of times before realizing it was a boulangerie as the sign makes it look like it might be a designer furniture store or something, but when I realized what it was and tried their croissants, I was sold.  They are open at six in the morning and have fresh, buttery, fluffy croissants coming on trays out of the oven all day.  Best croissants in Montreal! Make sure you try the one with blue cheese. 
Their coffees are good too, and fairly priced.

La réputation des pâtisseries de cette excellent café d'Hochelaga n'est plus à faire et dépasse maintenant largement les frontières de notre beau quartier ! Il y a même une succursale au quartier dix-trente à Brossard maintenant ! J'adore le pain baguette et les croisants !

Had a delicious ham, egg and swiss croissant. It was probably the best croissant I have ever had! May need to come back to try the chocolate croissant. They have a beautiful array of baked goods, as well as breads and cheeses.

Du pain artisanal aux succulents cafés de cette boulangerie, tout ici est délicieux. Excellent choix de viennoiseries. Et une jolie terrasse vous permet de vous prélasser au soleil sur la place Valois. Un coup de coeur assuré.

Went there twice for breakfast on our visit to Montreal initial based on the recommendations from our AirBnB host. Very fresh pastries and outstanding coffee. The sandwiches looked appetizing as well, and co-located with the cafe is a small shop selling bread and cheese.

brunch on lucky weekday off. it seemed relaxing inside but there were actually few seats left. even Monday morning. waao!

patisserie, coffee and service are simply awesome. i love their non-too-sweet style very much. decoration is pretty and there are lots home made products available as well. 

i should try their cheese next time.

If you're on your way to the botanical gardens, then stop by here quickly for some of the most delicious Croissants I've ever had for a nice energy boost. 

I found this place on yelp and was initially skeptical of the raving reviews, especially during the long walk from the Botanical Gardens down the street. But once I got here, I can tell quickly that the journey was well worth it! The bakery shop is separated into 3 parts: an outdoor seating area, an indoor cheese emporium, and an indoor bakery. While I may not be a cheese expert, the sweet scent of the baked French breads cannot be mistaken.

I tried both the butter Croissants and the unique pistachio croissants and they were absolutely phenomenal (I preferred the butter croissant, but I'm a traditionalist). The staff were also very friendly and served some of the best coffee I've had as well (black, no sugar).

Overall, this place was worth the walk and the exploration and a definite place to visit if you're around the area.

Food: 5 stars
Price: 5 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars
Service: 4 stars

Rien a dire tout est bonnet mon dieu que ce genre de commerce fait du bien à Homa! Les pains, les fromages, de tout pour la raclette, les entrées et les dessert! Essayer leur sandwich a l'agneau en passant et très bon latte! J'achète régulièrement mes cadeaux d'hôtesse la, ça fait différent du vin!

Une superbe boulangerie/fromagerie. Les produits y sont excellents, les pains bien meilleurs que ceux de Première Moisson. Le personnel est toujours sympathique et courtois. Les viennoiseries extraordinaires et les pâtisseries aussi. Ils ont aussi la meilleure galette des rois de Montréal.
Je n'avais jamais mangé de canelés avant. Maintenant je suis accroc. Merci ArHoMa!
La chocolatine aux pistaches est divine,  La baguette, le pain de campane et la fougasse aux olives valent aussi le détour

We visited Montreal for several days and visited many bakeries during our stay. This one ranks near the top. We tried an assortment of pastries with friends and everyone loved them. The standout was a raspberry, pistachio, cheese cake one that had just the right amounts of crust, creme and glaze. We bought a bunch of croissant, chocolatines (some with pistachio) and pains au raisins to take back to the US. We should have purchased more, because they are now all gone within 1 day.

Hochelaga was the original Huron place name for this beautiful island that we inhabit. Hochelaga is where it all started -- it's where it all began. Then a series of unfortunate events happen ... the warlike Iroquois killed most of the peace-loving Huron people. Then along came Jacques Cartier who built our home on Native's land. Then the limey English came and we all know what happened next. Je me souviens des plaines d'Abraham ôsti! The Americans were next. Notwithstanding the five hundred years of overdue back paid rent and tax we all owe to First Nations people for genocide, rape and displacement, the dictatorial regime of Maurice Duplessis, Anglo hegemony and oppression of the Québécois, FLQ kidnappings, bombs in Westmount Park trash cans, two referendums, the faltering loonie that was worth 67 cents USD, a pretty crazy ice storm and Celine Dion's Titanic song - not withstanding all that heavy heavy shit - times have been great and they are getting even better. Hochelaga represent! East side! ArHoMa is 100% legit. Everybody knows that Hochelaga-Maisonneuve is the best borough in this city with the best salt-of-the-earth people in this city and now my childhood hood has the best food as well! While contributing a tad bit to the process of gentrification in HoMa it makes up for it in sheer quality, taste and value for dollar. This is the best, allow me to stress that again, ArHoMa is seriously the best pâtisserie, boulangerie, café, bakery and fromagerie in Montréal hands down. Where else on God's green earth can you find the ingenious conceptualisation that is the pistachio chocolatine or pistachio croissant? This is a very very dangerous item of food. It is a thing of glory. The erotic, eclectic and eccentric interplay of sweet dark chocolate, perfectly buttery flakey croissant along with the nutty saltiness of the pistachio make for an elegant, deep and beauteous cacophony of intriguing flavour inside your mouth. These pastries are always flying off the shelves faster than they come out of the oven so it's good to go early. They do make them several times a day, I understand, so try and get yours piping hot out of the oven but if not it's still damn good. They also have excellent breads baking at multiple times during the day. Get yourself one or two of the cheeses from their extensive selection and go have a picnic by yourself or with a lover or friend. Be sure to enjoy the ginormous terrace and post-modern sculpture garden and benches of Place-Simon-Valois that they've got open to patrons and the public alike. This place is a thing of beauty. Enjoy yourself and bon appétit à tous !
The food is delicious. We ordered two sandwiches and hot chocolate and they were really nice. Good service and fast.

I'm basically copying my review of La Fabrique Arhoma. 

Location: In Place Valois, on Ontario Est... I drove so can't say what subway stop is close-by. Street parking is available but there's a lot of construction in the area so it's a sh*t show.

The place: This space is much bigger than La Fabrique, with the bread section on one side and the rest of the goodies on the other. They also had cheeses and sandwiches. This is a pick-up joint so you can't sit down and eat your goodies.

The goods: I first discovered Arhoma through Lufa, when I ordered a basic white loaf of bread. Holy crap, do these guys make good bread! The loaf has a great consistency and is super tasty. I like a hint of saltiness in my bread and this one totally delivered. A friend of mine swears by their baguettes - I haven't tried them but I'm confident that they rock. I stopped in last weekend because I needed a pick-me-up from walking around, hunting for street art all day. I decided to go for the pistachio chocolatine, which, by the way, is enormous. I guess I lucked out because when I started picking at it, it still had a hint of warmth to it, and the chocolate was all melty. The chocolatine was super, super moist and literally melted in my mouth. I mean, it was impossible not to have a mouthgasm while I ate this thing. Because it was so big, I ate half right away and saved the rest for later. I've also tried their chocolate lava cakes and it's equally delicious. What I like is that the chocolate is not too rich, so you can totally eat the whole thing in one sitting. I wouldn't share, if I were you. On this visit, I tried a brownie. It was incredibly chocolatey and dense - I ate half and saved the rest for later. Lastly, if you see the pistachio/rhubarb bread, go for it. It's amazing!

Service: OK.

Price point: Pretty good. You can get a great loaf of bread for under $4, the chocolatine and brownie were about $3 each. These guys are top notch in terms of using quality ingredients. Check it!

Boulangerie dans Les Cours Valois qui offrent une sélection de pains intéressante.  La qualité de la fraîcheur du pain est variable, c'est arrivé à quelques reprises que le pain ne semblait pas frais du jour.  Le point fort de cette boulangerie est la section fromagerie.  Elle offre un grand choix de fromages, il y en a pour tous les goûts.  De plus, à chaque fois que je demandais conseils aux gens derrière le comptoir, ils ont toujours su me guider vers des suggestions de fromages qui allaient ultimement me plaîre.  On y retrouve des sandwichs fait sur place, des pâtisseries, différentes épices de Phillipe de Vienne, des charcuteries et j'en passe.  Une place à visiter si vous êtes dans le coin!
Bon endroit pour un croissant, un pain de boulangerie et du fromage. Le personnel est toujours souriant. Peu de places assises sont disponibles.

Tasty breads and local cheeses.

Add to that a terrace, coffee, pastries + hearty sandwiches and you have a winning combo of awesome..at least imho.

Worth a visit, or 500.

I really like cheese.

When you have a coffee outside your house you want your experience to be one that elevates not only your tastebuds but your entire day, this place kind of does that. A simple coffee that isn't too expensive, home made baked goods that are restaurant quality and a feeling that you are paying for a coffee better than the one you can make at home. You really can't get that at the chain coffee shops, not these days. Community based I would say it's better than most coffee shops in Old Montreal, try the chocolate brownie or pain au chocolat with a cup of hand pressed coffee, it's worth your $5.

Le croissant est certainement une des créations en boulangerie qui demande le plus de soins et il est difficile de trouver de bons croissants à Montréal. Ceux de Arhoma sont délicieux! Feuilletés avec un bon goût de beurre, ça vaut la peine de traverser une partie de la ville juste pour ça! Leurs pains sont généralement bien réussis aussi.

Bought their pecan/cranberry bread, it's really good. My sister bought their sourdough baguette, and she was pleased as well. She's quite the picky coffee/bread/food person, so I guess this was something to hear from her. I have to add she's an excellent cook/baker so I suppose the  pickiness  comes with that. Nice little square to sit & enjoy your coffee/pastry/croissant etc , go for a stroll in Ontario Village afterwards.

Mon café préféré!! Les lattes sont excellents  et je tiens à souligner la qualité du personnel, j'y vais régulièrement et les personnes qui y travaillent sont toujours très sympathique, sans exception!! Ça aide d'habiter en face!
Very cool place to get a sandwich and dessert. Grabbed some croissants and baguettes for the ride back to NY. Great cheese selection. Will be my regular stop now when in Montreal.

Wow. This place has some seriously good coffee and pastries, like that hasn't been said numerous times before. After I woke up much earlier than usual since I can't stand the heat waves that come later in the day, I decided to come here to fulfill my ideal combination of crisp mornings in a cozy environment with good food. Needless to say, I was not disappointed.

I ordered a large cappuccino and a chocolatine with a window seat to go along with them. The chocolatine was probably one of the best I've had in my life. It was perfectly buttery, flaky, and had just the right amount of (dark!) chocolate so that it wasn't too sweet or heavy but still rich and satisfying. I'm not going to lie; I was pretty sad when I finished it because I wanted another one, but alas, PUSWS (Poor Uni Student's Wallet Syndrome) prevented me from doing so. The cappuccino was also great, but the barista asked me if I wanted maple sugar on top, to which I replied yes. The flavor ended up not coming through, however, so I was slightly disappointed. It was still a lovely cup though.

Come here if you need a delicious pick-me-up to set the mood for the rest of the day or if you just want to have a coffee date with a friend. It really is worth a bus trip if you live in the McGill bubble like me.

Cette boulangerie du quartier Hochelaga-Maisonneuve offre un pain d'une rare qualité, de délicieux sandwichs et une belle sélection de fromages, pour la plupart québécois. Se réclamant du quartier, «Arhoma» est en quelque sorte un mot-valise dans lequel on retrouve «Arôme» et «HoMa», surnom donné par plusieurs à Hochelaga-Maisonneuve. Cependant, on est très loin des patateries qui persillent le quartier ; Arhoma offre un pain qui vaut bien celui de Première moisson et ses viennoiseries toutes aussi bien faites. Finalement, les sandwichs sont vraiment délicieux et offrent une alternative heureuse aux hot-dogs servis à tous les coins de rues sur Ontario.

Vacationed in Montreal for a few days, chose to eat here on a complete whim. What a happy accident! Staff was fantastically nice (one of the guys at the counter taught me to say "spoon" in French when my very basic abilities failed) and food was delicious. My sister and I both ate the veggie sandwich, which was deliciously loaded with grilled vegetables and goat cheese. I also got one of their chia puddings and a latte. Great lunch, only wish I would've grabbed some bread and pastries to go based on other reviews.

Just what we needed, two blocks from the apartment where we were staying.  Great coffees. Morning pastries....the 'apricotine' was exceptional, as was the 'croissant nature.'  We could eat here every day.  Walked out to an impromptu interlude when a young man sat at the plaza piano and played several songs.

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? The bread is amazing; the cheese and meat counter offer an eclectic selection of goods, and you can spend hours perusing this place, and still find something delicious on the shelves. 

I usually stop in for a ready-to-eat sandwich which can be warmed on site if you're looking for a quick lunch. The flavours are bold and creative, and the sandwiches are always fresh and made with quality ingredients; worth the average 8$. 

What I really love about this place is their baked goods. From their pastries to their cakes, it's hard to choose! I opted for their chocolate brownie today which is huge! It's soft but crumbly and filled with huge walnuts; it's just amazing! I often order my cakes from here too; if you have a chance to order one of their annual Christmas logs, do not hesitate!

L'avantage #1, il est à deux pas de chez moi. L'avantage #2, leurs produits sont vraiment très bons ! L'inconvénient #1 ca rend vraiment addict (donc gare aux kilos en trop) et l'inconvénient #2 c'est qu'on a envie de tout acheter pour tout goûter ! 
J'ai pu tester plusieurs variétés de pains, tous très bons, avec des choix de pains au levain (non négligeable !), et récemment leurs pâtisseries ! Tout est vraiment excellent, un peu cher à mon goût (mais c'est pour toutes les boulangeries pâtisseries un peu pareil) mais ca en vaut la peine. Le personnel est très souriant et très accueillant. J'y retourne aussi souvent que possible et toujours avec le sourire en ressortant ! 
Si vous êtes dans le coin, courrez-y !

Very nice bakery/cafe with excellent sandwiches and pastries.  We enjoyed breakfast here--a croissant sandwich with eggs, brie and ham makes your average American cafe pale by comparison.   Bustling atmosphere but quiet.  Pistachio croissants, chocolate croissants are  superb.  Lots of other choices as well.... Even early on  a Saturday morning this place was busy--no wonder.  Service was friendly, efficient, and all staff spoke English.

Cet endroit est extraordinaire, je vous le dis tout de suite.
On y trouve, bien sûr, d'excellent pain (la baguette a une croûte bien craquante), mais aussi une vaste sélection de fromages québécois, des pâtés et terrines (allô les pique-niques!), des cafés très, très bien faits, de bonnes viennoiseries au beurre, des gâteaux à se rouler à terre, des sandwichs absolument fantastiques (un peu chers, mais ça vaut le coût), et des produits d'épicerie fine, tant frais que surgelés.
Le personnel est très sympathique, mais l'endroit est exigu, une douzaine de places assises tout au plus (quelques tables sont installées dehors l'été, l'endroit étant situé sur la place Simon-Valois).
Une des meilleures adresses en ville!

Fini les pains du première moisson !  Voici notre nouvel endroit favori pour trouver LA baguette de pain et LE fromage parfaits pour un souper parfait ! les employés connaissent leurs produits et savent bien vous conseiller selon vos goûts !! 

Vraiment un endroit parfait pour agrémenter un souper entre amis ou encore en amoureux  !

Trop de chi-chi! = Manque de productivité!
Sans pouvoir dire du mal de la qualité des produits, ni même de leur délicieux chaï latté, le service laisse largement à désirer! TROP de personnel INUTILE censé libérer la file d'attente, malheureusement le scénario se répète: Il y a dix personnes devant vous, on vous demande votre commande, vous attendez 10 mins dans la file, vous passez à la caisse, vous attendez 10 mins encore que votre commande vous soit livrée... Que se passe t-il entre le moment où vous commandez un sandwich froid et le moment où vous le recevez? Sérieusement, nul besoin de le couper en deux et l'emballer dans un petit papier brun avec une petite ficelle pour que ce soit mignon, vu que c'est déjà bon. Et ça marche aussi avec le chaï latté, ou la simple baguette de pain que vous demandez au boulanger et qui vous snobe en disant qu'il y en a dans le panier devant vous, oui mais moi, c'est celle bien cuite sur l'étagère que je veux! Si les personnes qui prennent les commandes pourraient être un peu plus réactives et entreprenantes, ça justifierait, soit dit en passant, le prix élevé des articles du magasin!

J'adore le pain et je considère que faire un bon pain est un art. Chez Arhoma, le pain est sacré et produit avec soin et talent. 

J'ai acheté une miche de pain au levain, délicieuse. Nous l'avons dévorée tout rond avec notre souper. La mie était tendre et légèrement acidulée, le pain avait une bonne croûte. Parfait, quoi!

Pour une petite place, il y a un bon choix de pains, sucrés et salés, de belles pâtisseries et des viennoiseries appétissantes.

Une des meilleures boulangeries à Montréal!

Was here in July 2012.  I was a great neighborhood find.  Amazing freshly-made pastries...forget what you know about almond croissants and go for the pistachio - the best when fresh outta the oven.  The other side of the store is a gourmet market with fresh cheeses and such.  Good for breakfast and lunch or just a little caffeine.  I believe the closest subway stop is Joliette.  You will wish you had such a nice cafe in your own hood.

Been to this Hochelaga gem a couple of times now. If I lived closer, I would be a regular. Their pistachio croissants are ridiculously good. Their baguettes are great too. I haven't tried their sandwiches, but they look tasty and seem like to be good value for the money. I had a pretty good coffee here, and the service was as friendly as it gets. If you're heading up to check out Value Village, do yourself a favor and swing by this place on the way home. You won't regret it.
Tried the croissant today after reading here about how good it was and it was awesome.  It must not have been out of the oven that long because it was still warm making it even better!

Super boulangerie, un super endroit pour déjeuner, la terrasse est belle mais la température à fait que je n'ai pas profiter, le pain est parfait et le gâteau à la bière aussi. Super endroit dans homa
Their pistachio croissants are the best! Plus, their bakery attached to their fromagerie!
